channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ray Dalio says AI is in ‘the early stages of a bubble,’ so watch out for 2026
item.description: After strong returns in U.S. markets last year, 2026 might be a different story.

item.title: When brands play hard to get: why you’re drawn to products that neg you
item.description: We call this “dissuasive framing.” Instead of saying a product is perfect for everyone, a company is up front about who it might not be for.

item.title: Amazon is cutting checks to millions of customers as part of a $2.5 billion FTC settlement. Here’s who qualifies and how to get paid
item.description: The $2.5 billion package ranks among the largest enforcement actions in the agency’s history.

item.title: Defense spending could rise following US arrest of Venezuela's Maduro, analyst says
item.description: The Trump administration's arrest of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro could lead to an increase in defense spending as the White House looks to counte...

item.title: 5 Ways To Make Your Dog Happier This Year
item.description: From teaching a dog a new trick like "spin" to putting away our phones on dog walks, there are easy ways to make our dogs happy every day.

item.title: 5 Ways To Make New Year’s Resolutions Last From ‘Atomic Habits’ Author James Clear
item.description: James Clear explains on the Huberman Lab podcast why habits stick through systems, identity and environment rather than sheer willpower.

item.title: ‘365 Buttons’: The Viral TikTok Meme Inspiring A New Year’s Life Motto
item.description: A cryptic comment left on a TikTok video by a user named Tamara has sparked the first big meme of 2026, a blend of silliness and self-empowerment.

item.title: Trump And RFK Jr. Change Childhood Vaccine Schedule To Align With Outlier Nation
item.description: Childhood vaccine schedules among U.S. peers differ marginally. Unlike the U.S., however, peer health officials don't sow doubt among the public about...

item.title: Maduro's removal could reverse decades of economic struggles for Venezuelans
item.description: The arrest of Nicolás Maduro in a U.S. raid could bring relief to average Venezuelans after decades of economic mismanagement led to rampant inflation...

item.title: From Latin America’s richest country 100 years ago to a founding member of OPEC, the long history of Venezuela’s oil and U.S. ties, explained
item.description: In the 1990s, Venezuelan society became further split between the wealthy, who wanted to work with the US, and the working class, who didn't.

item.title: Want AI agents to work better? Improve the way they retrieve information, Databricks says
item.description: Databricks is debuting a new system for retrieving the data that AI agents need to perform tasks accurately.

item.title: LEGO SMART Play Targets 2026 Tech Revolution, Starting With Star Wars
item.description: LEGO believes SMART Play is "one of the most significant evolutions" for the brand since the introduction of the minifigure in 1978.

item.title: Iconic children's toy brand goes high-tech to bring creations 'to life' without screens
item.description: LEGO introduces revolutionary screen-free SMART Play technology at CES 2026, bringing interactive sounds and lights to physical builds.

item.title: Texas, Florida again top U-Haul 'Growth Index'
item.description: Texas, Florida and other southern states are the places in the U.S. where people moved to the most in 2025, according to U-Haul's latest "Growth Index...

item.title: Dow up over 500 points in final hour, on track to close above 49K for first time
The surprising stocks powering the chip sector to its first new high in a month
MarketWatch's Money Challenge, Day 3: Make a plan to save 25% to 40% of your pay
Why Friday’s job report should move the Treasury market more than Venezuela
As Tesla’s stock falls, Elon Musk brushes off Nvidia’s competitive threat
Maduro’s capture puts Cuba’s Venezuelan oil-dependent economy at risk
item.description: The U.S. military captures Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro, threatening Cuba's economy as the nation loses a key provider of oil supplies for communi...

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
